briefdescription.para: Default constructor; optionally pass the parent object.
Copy constructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, const wxRichTextRange &range, const wxRichTextSelection &selection, const wxRect &rect, int descent, int style)
memberdef.name: Draw

briefdescription.para: Draw the item, within the given range.

detaileddescription.para: Some objects may ignore the range (for example paragraphs) while others must obey it (lines, to implement wrapping)

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, const wxPoint &pt, long &textPosition, wxRichTextObject **obj, wxRichTextObject **contextObj, int flags=0)
memberdef.name: HitTest

briefdescription.para: Hit-testing: returns a flag indicating hit test details, plus information about position.

detaileddescription.para: contextObj is returned to specify what object position is relevant to, since otherwise there's an ambiguity. @ obj might not be a child of contextObj, since we may be referring to the container itself if we have no hit on a child - for example if we click outside an object.
The function puts the position in textPosition if one is found. pt is in logical units (a zero y position is at the beginning of the buffer).

briefdescription.para: Returns the XML node name of this object.

detaileddescription.para: This must be overridden for wxXmlNode-base XML export to work.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, const wxRect &rect, const wxRect &parentRect, int style)
memberdef.name: Layout

briefdescription.para: Lay the item out at the specified position with the given size constraint.

detaileddescription.para: Layout must set the cached size. rect is the available space for the object, and parentRect is the container that is used to determine a relative size or position (for example if a text box must be 50% of the parent text box).

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, wxSize &size, int &descent, wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, int flags, const wxPoint &position=wxPoint(0, 0), const wxSize &parentSize=wxDefaultSize, wxArrayInt *partialExtents=NULL) const
memberdef.name: GetRangeSize

briefdescription.para: Returns the object size for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: Returns false if the range is invalid for this object.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the given range.
Returns any text in this object for the given range.
Imports this object from XML.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, long index, wxPoint &pt, int *height, bool forceLineStart)
memberdef.name: FindPosition

briefdescription.para: Finds the absolute position and row height for the given character position.
Calculates the range of the object.

detaileddescription.para: By default, guess that the object is 1 unit long.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this object can handle the selections of its children, fOr example a table.

detaileddescription.para: Required for composite selection handling to work.

briefdescription.para: Returns a selection object specifying the selections between start and end character positions.

detaileddescription.para: For example, a table would deduce what cells (of range length 1) are selected when dragging across the table.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if we can edit the object's properties via a GUI.
Edits the object's properties via a GUI.
Returns the label to be used for the properties context menu item.
Returns true if objects of this class can accept the focus, i.e. a call to SetFocusObject is possible.

detaileddescription.para: For example, containers supporting text, such as a text box object, can accept the focus, but a table can't (set the focus to individual cells instead).

briefdescription.para: Returns the cells array.
Returns the cells array.
Returns the row count.
Returns the column count.
Returns the cell at the given row/column position.
Returns the cell at the given character position (in the range of the table).
Returns the row/column for a given character position.
Returns the coordinates of the cell with keyboard focus, or (-1,-1) if none.
Clears the table.
Creates a table of the given dimensions.
Sets the attributes for the cells specified by the selection.
Deletes rows from the given row position.
Deletes columns from the given column position.
Adds rows from the given row position.
Adds columns from the given column position.
Clones the object.
wxRichTextTable represents a table with arbitrary columns and rows.
